body: Christian, That's a very good question that I have also wanted to know the answer to for some time.  The only thing that I know might get close to addressing your issue is modeling insulated blinds with a dynamic schedule: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/5su4fxPuQsr--ktKujtc1VW8djD5RCCtLdkj*GxEjfilvMlm7lN0j9H7AiSQ7Cs8DPJCL6uLWTZh8YSUvTHn1UC3MpiQd7bH/DynamicInsulatedBlinds.JPG) For just modulating the U-Value of a typical wall or window construction, it seems like you will have to go with the intense EMS option that Jeremy mentions on Mostapha's unmet-hours post.  I have wanted such a feature to help me more accurately model operable windows that are in an open vs closed state.  If I end up developing anything to help with an EMS workflow like this, I will let you know. -Chris
